column4: Anyone knows a way to lower the volume with rhytmbox with the terminal? Right now I can only set it to a certain amount with 'rhythmbox --set-volume 0.8', and I want to turn it down by a bit with every keypress
wow, "--set-volume" doesn't work either for me. What are you using?
and this feature was removed in edgy?!
you could set it once, write the set value to a file, and write a script which takes the current volume level from the file, calculate the new value to set, and set it
yeah I thought about that too, it's dirty though <:
no it doesn't work for me. The default rhythmbox on edgy doesn't seem to have *any* features for manipulating an existing rhythmbox
indeed, it doesn't appear to be there, or we're looking at the wrong section of the help
I guess this is a warning to never upgrade to Edgy :-)
no, edgy is Ubuntu's latest *stable* release (since October)
it will be supported for the usual 18 months, IIRC. (Dapper for 3 years.)
meh, so far I haven't found anything as feature rich and light as utorrent
